results.title: Summer, or grief
results.brief_description: In this single-channel videotape, a sequence of personal, light-filled images alternates with single words and short phrases in a stark white font against black background. The imagery consists of stills, pans, tracking shots, and long pulls-to-focus of everyday subjects photographed in and around the artist’s summer home in Upstate New York over the course of several summers. The text, an excerpt from `The Conversation’ by poet Allen Grossman, is an eloquent but dark meditation on loss and the passage of time. The tape is about appearance and interiority, surface and undercurrent, and the coexistence of the dark in the light, apprehension and beauty in common experience.

results.title: Summer scene
results.brief_description: Shows tourist attractions of Western Australia’s South West region in spring and summer. Includes wildflowers, spectacular Karri forests near Pemberton and the Pemberton swimming pool, trout fishing, and Yallingup’s caves and rocky coastal beaches.

results.title: Summer pageantry
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Hector Lemieux and Nicholas Balla
results.brief_description: It is a sight to gladden the heart of every spectator when the changing of the guard takes place on the broad green lawns of Ottawa’s Parliament Buildings and when the band of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police plays their sunset Retreat. Both traditional ceremonies are shown in full colour, as are other points of interest in and around the city including scenic drives and waterways, historic stone buildings and modern edifices.

results.title: Summer of the seventeenth doll [discussion]
results.brief_description: Peter Fitzpatrick from Monash University is an expert on Ray Lawler’s play. He looks at its dramatic heritage and how the play farewells the myth of the male bush hero by showing what hapens when the old values of the outback hero and urban domesticity are in conflict.

results.title: Summer of the seventeenth doll [Australian Opera]
results.brief_description: Ray Lawler’s classic play, set in Melbourne in the 1950’s, is brought to life in this operatic adaptation recorded at the Playhouse, Victorian Arts Centre. Cast includes Elizabeth Campbell, Gillian Sullivan, Natalie Jones, Eilene Hannan, Barry Ryan, Gary Rowley and Nicholas Todorovic. Music by the Victorian State Opera is composed and conducted by Richard Mills. Performance produced and directed by Peter Butler.

results.title: Summer is for kids
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sydney Newman and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: The warmly human narrative of what two weeks at a Muskoka summer camp meant to a small boy from a congested city area. School was out. Roger had passed. Next year he’d be using ink, but in the meantime there wasn’t much to do around town. Then, one wonderful day, Roger went off to camp. It was all fun, the preliminary scramble for the upper bunk in the cabin, exploring in the woods, cooking food over a fire, and - biggest day of all - passing the beginner’s swimming test. The two weeks went by so quickly, but it was the best time Roger had ever had, and one he would never forget. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: Summer interlude
results.brief_description: The lives of the inhabitants of a Swedish seaboard village that becomes a resort in summer are contrasted with those of visitors. The atmosphere of a little fishing village is beautifully caught - the impact of trippers on it equally well described. The film has all the best of Sucksdorff’s qualities - a strong pictorial style, human observation, and a simple flowing narrative.

results.title: Sultans of swing: the very best of Dire Straits
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Video International and Marghie Evans
results.brief_description: ‘Sultans of swing’ features 16 of Dire Strait’s most popular songs including: “Sultans of swing”, “Lady writer”, “Romeo and Juliet”, “Tunnel of love”, “Private investigations”, “Twisting by the pool”, “Love over gold (live)”, “So far away”, “Money for nothing”, “Brothers in arms”, “Walk of life”, “Calling Elvis”, “Heavy fuel”, “On every street”, “Your latest trick (live)” and “Local hero - wild theme (live)”.

results.title: Sulphur and its compounds. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Using molecular models, animation and time-lapse photography, this film demonstrates the chemical and physical properties of sulphur, including the formation of its allotropic forms. Also describes the Frasch process, and emphasises the importance of sulphur and its compounds, especially sulphuric acid, in modern industry, medicine and agriculture.

results.title: Suivez-Moi Jeune Homme! = Follow Me Young Man!
results.creator_credit: Paul Cadeac, Marcel Lathiere and Guy Le Franc
results.brief_description:
Oranos, a wealthy greek business man, is in love with Francoise, a jewellery shop attendant, who consistantly rebuffs him. Suspecting she may already have a boyfriend, he is having her followed by Michel, a private detective, who promptly falls in love with her.

Credits: Producer, Paul Cadeac, Marcel Lathiere ; director, Guy Le Franc ; writers, Roland Moronval, Jean Halain ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Louiguy.
Cast: Dany Robin, Daniel Gelin, Lona Rita, Jacques Jouanneau, Noel Roquevert, Georges Chamarat, Michel Galabru, Fernand Sardoux.
